article.headline: Coronavirus tally: Global cases of COVID-19 17 million, 667,688 deaths and U.S. death toll hits 150,716
article.body: The global tally for confirmed cases of the coronavirus that causes COVID-19 climbed above 17 million on Thursday, according to data aggregated by Johns Hopkins University, and the death toll rose to 667,688. At least 9.9 million people have recovered. The U.S. case tally climbed to 4.43 million and the death toll rose to 151,716, after crossing 150,000 late Wednesday. California and Florida posted single-day record death numbers on Wednesday and California added more than 12,300 cases, according to the New York Times. Brazil is second to the U.S. with 2.6 million cases and 90,134 deaths. India is third measured by cases at 1.6 million, followed by Russia with 832,993 and South Africa with 471,123. The U.K. has 303,063 cases and 46,046 fatalities, the highest in Europe and third highest in the world. China, where the illness was first reported late last year, has 87,362 cases, and 4,658 fatalities.
